intro: Baeckea ericoides f. tetrasticha, commonly known as the four-stamen baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and a compact, bushy habit. Its botanical features include four stamens in each flower, which distinguish it from other forms of Baeckea ericoides. It is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
